questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    when the construction of the Mumbwa Trades Training Institute will commence; and
(b)    why the K6 million which was allocated to the project in 2013 has not yet been released.

Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    when the construction of Kalabo Trades Training Institute will be completed;
(b)    how long the project has been running;
(c)    how much money has so far been spent on the project;
(d)    whether the project is within the time-frame for completion and, if not, what has led to the overrun;
(e)    what measures have been taken to ensure the project is completed on time; and
(f)    whether there are any plans to build additional student hostels at the Institute.

questions.minister: Minister of Mines, Energy and Water Development
parts: (a)    when the Government will construct dams in the following chiefdoms of Lumezi Parliamentary Constituency:
(i)    Chief Zumwenda; (ii)    Chief Chikomeni; (iii)    Chief Mwase-Mphangwe; (iv)    Chief Kazembe;
(v)    Chief Chitungulu; and (vi)    Chief Mwanya; and
(b)    why it has taken long to commence dam construction in the Constituency.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and communication whether the Government has any plans to re-introduce the Roads Department Camps for purposes of enhancing the maintenance of the road infrastructure especially in rural areas.

parts: (a)    whether the Government has any plans to build maternity wings at the following health posts in Kafulafuta Parliamentary Constituency:
(i)    Miengwe; (ii)    Matipa; (iii)    Lupiya; (iv)    Mutaba;
(v)    Katonte; (vi)    Bangwe; and (vii)    Chiwala High School;
(b)    if so, when the plans will be implemented; and
(c)    what the cost of constructing one maternity wing is.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    how many teachers in Lukulu East and Lukulu West Parliamentary Constituencies were retired from 2011 to 2013, year by year;
(b)    whether terminal benefits for the retired teachers have been paid and, if not, why; and
(c)    when the terminal benefits will be paid.
(a)    when reliable transport will be provided to the District Agricultural Office in Kapiri Mposhi; and
(b)    whether the Government has any plans to provide transport to agricultural extension workers to enable them carry out their duties effectively.

questions.minister: Minister of Information and Broadcasting when the Zambia National Broadcasting Corporation radio and television signals in Katete District will be strengthened.

parts: (a)    how many tonnes of rice are produced, on average, annually in Lumezi Parliamentary Constituency;
(b)    how many farmers were supported through the Farmer Input Support Programme (FISP) to produce rice in the Constituency from 2012 to 2014, year by year; and
(c)    if none, when the Government will extend the FISP to the rice farmers in the Constituency.

questions.minister: Minister of Labour and Social Security
parts: (a)    what the cost of constructing each housing unit by the National Pension Scheme Authority in Kalulushi District was; and
(b)    whether the prices of the housing units will be revised downwards to enable many citizens acquire descent accommodation.
(a)    whether the growing of Jatropha in the Western Province is viable;
(b)    if so, how much crop was produced in the 2012/2013 season;
(c)    what measures have been taken to promote the growing of Jatropha in the Province;
(d)    which Province produced the largest quantity of Jatropha in 2013; and
(e)    what the hectarage cultivated at (d) was. QUESTIONS FOR WRITTEN ANSWER W39    Mr Musonda (Kapiri Mposhi) - to ask the Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education:
(a)    how many teachers from Kapiri Mposhi District were retired from 2000 to 2013, year by year; and

(b)    what measures the Government has taken to pay the outstanding benefits to retired teachers. W40    Mr Mutelo (Lukulu West) - to ask the Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education:
(a)    when the construction of an ablution block at Kazombozombo Primary School in Lukulu West Parliamentary Constituency will commence;
(b)    what the estimated cost of the project is; and

(c)    when funds for the project will be released.
